life.threedee

Class Plane

  • java.lang.Object
    • life.threedee.Plane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ThreeDeeObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GhostHouseDoor, MapPlane, TexturedPlane, Triangle, TunnelPlane

    public class Plane
extends java.lang.Object
implements ThreeDeeObject
    A Plane, represented with an origin point and normal vector. Also has a color to render if it is the closest object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.awt.Color c
      The color of the plane
      protected Vector normal
      The normal vector for this plane
      protected Point origin
      The origin Point of this Plane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Plane(Point a, Point b, Point c)
      Constructs a new plane from the three points with a random color
      Plane(Point a, Point b, Point c, java.awt.Color colour)
      Constructs a new plane from the three points with the given color
      Plane(Point origin, Vector normal)
      Constructs a new plane with the given origin and normal with a random color
      Plane(Point origin, Vector normal, java.awt.Color c)
      Constructs a new plane with the given origin and normal with the given color

    • Method Detail

      • getRData

        public TColorTransfer getRData(Vector vector,
                      Point point,
                      double minT)
        Description copied from interface: ThreeDeeObject
        Returns the t value (see calculateT), color, and this for the given direction, point, and minimum t value. The minT is passed so as to avoid calculating color if it will not be used anyways.
        Specified by:
        getRData in interface ThreeDeeObject
        Returns:

      • intersection

        public Point intersection(Vector vector,
                 Point point,
                 double t)
        Description copied from interface: ThreeDeeObject
        Calculates the intersection point given the t value. Note: all this does is multiply the vector by t and add it to the point
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • evaluate

        public Point evaluate(double x,
             double y,
             double z)
        Call this with three values, the two you wish to plug in and a NaN that you wish to solve for. remember, if you give two values that are not part of the plane, you will get NaN back
